meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Why Apple Took The Risk With Maps

div.div: As the mobile game is shifting from hardware to services, Apple needs to have more deep services of its own, rather than relying on competition. And maps is an important control point for the company.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TWnaqH&via=Digg&text=Why Apple Took The Risk With Maps

div.a: The New Breed Of Forty-Niners Rushing To The Pacific

div.div: Lured by the soaring price of the precious metal, prospectors are heading for the California hills like it's 1849 all over again.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QBx23G&via=Digg&text=The New Breed Of Forty-Niners Rushing To The Pacific

div.a: How To Build An American Car

div.div: The new Cadillac ATS may be the most important domestic car since the Model T. It was built from dirt and steel by thousands of people over four years. It was engineered to beat the best foreign cars. But its sound, its feel, its guts are wholly American.

Iranian officials announced that they would soon introduce local alternatives to Google and its Gmail e-mail service, even as the country's media and even some officials stepped up complaints over Tehran's decision to enact a ban on Gmail in response to an anti-Islam film, newspapers reported on Sunday.
The promise of a grisly or dramatic ending is what gives the police pursuit its power.
Flight 121 from Paris to New York began on a clear autumn afternoon. It ended over 30 hours later. For those of us without miles, it is probably still going.

div.a: Fooled By The Onion: 8 Most Embarrassing Fails

div.div: Iran’s state-run media mistakes a fake poll from the satirical site for the real thing, joining The New York Times and an ESPN broadcaster on the list of those tricked by the humor periodical.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QxTugg&via=Digg&text=Fooled By The Onion: 8 Most Embarrassing Fails

div.a: Neil Young Launches Music Service For Audiophiles

div.div: Musician Neil Young has waged a battle against the audio quality of MP3s for years, but now he's bringing out the big guns -- a music service for audiophiles.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TVDxUF&via=Digg&text=Neil Young Launches Music Service For Audiophiles

div.a: Fish To Shrink By 25% Due To Climate Change

div.div: Global warming is likely to shrink the size of fish by as much as a quarter in coming decades, according to a groundbreaking new study of the world's oceans.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QsmuCF&via=Digg&text=Fish To Shrink By 25% Due To Climate Change

div.a: Want To Encourage Biking? Lose The Helmets

div.div: In the United States the notion that bike helmets promote health and safety by preventing head injuries is taken as pretty near God’s truth. Un-helmeted cyclists are regarded as irresponsible, like people who smoke. But many European health experts have taken a very different view.

li.div: "If you force or pressure people to wear helmets, you discourage them from riding bicycles." nytimes.com/2012/09/30/sun...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QAe7Zi&via=Digg&text=Want To Encourage Biking? Lose The Helmets

div.a: $150 Key Set Provides All-Access Pass To NYC

div.div: A man is selling a set of five keys that would allow control of virtually any elevator in NYC, could knock out power to municipal buildings and skyscrapers, darken city streets, open subway gates and some firehouse doors and provide full access to 1 World Trade Center and other construction sites.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SvY6zu&via=Digg&text=$150 Key Set Provides All-Access Pass To NYC

div.a: Pirate Bay Founder Remains Locked Up Without Charges

div.div: Gottfrid Svartholm will be kept in detention for at least two more weeks on suspicion of hacking into a Swedish IT company connected to the country’s tax authorities. According to Prosecutor Henry Olin the extended detention is needed “to prevent him from having contact with other people.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SclqbU&via=Digg&text=Pirate Bay Founder Remains Locked Up Without Charges

div.div: U.S. News likes to claim that it uses rigorous methodology when it ranks colleges, but, honestly, it’s just a list put together by magazine editors. The whole exercise is a little silly. Or rather, it would be if it weren’t so pernicious.

div.a: Latest 'Insider' Attack Marks 2,000th U.S. Death In Afghan War

div.div: There was yet another green-on-blue attack in Afghanistan on Sunday in which two Americans and three Afghans were killed. The death of a U.S. soldier brings the total number of troop deaths in the Afghan war to over 2,000.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NYH0Oz&via=Digg&text=Latest 'Insider' Attack Marks 2,000th U.S. Death In Afghan War

div.div: Inflation can be a headache for any central banker. But it takes a certain type of economist to know what to do when a belligerent spaceship fleet attacks an interstellar trading post, causing mineral prices to surge across the galaxy.
